Address.Line: Room 502 Jack E. Brown building 3122 TAMU

Platform.Title: [Ecoli_ASv2] Affymetrix E. coli Antisense Genome Array
Platform.Description:
Affymetrix submissions are typically submitted to GEO using the GEOarchive method described at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/geo/info/geo_affy.html
Has 7312 entries and was indexed 20-May-2002. The GeneChip E. coli Antisense Genome Array can be used for examining expression of all known E. coli genes and discovering novel, uncharacterized intergenic transcripts. The array contains probe sets to detect the antisense strand of more than 4,200 known open reading frames. In addition, over 1,350 intergenic sequences can be interrogated in both directions permitting functional characterization of potentially important shorter expressed sequences. Sequence information for probes on the array correspond to the M49 version of the E. coli Genome Project database at the University of Wisconsin.
Keywords = high density oligonucleotide array

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: Affymetrix Probe Set ID

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Locus tag

Column.Name: Species Scientific Name
Column.Description: The genus and species of the organism represented by the probe set.

Column.Name: Annotation Date
Column.Description: The date that the annotations for this probe array were last updated. It will generally be earlier than the date when the annotations were posted on the Affymetrix web site.

Column.Name: Sequence Type
Column.Description: Indicates whether the sequence is an Exemplar, Consensus or Control sequence. An Exemplar is a single nucleotide sequence taken directly from a public database. This sequence could be an mRNA or EST. A Consensus sequence, is a nucleotide sequence assembled by Affymetrix, based on one or more sequence taken from a public database.

Column.Name: Representative Public ID
Column.Description: The accession number of a representative sequence. Note that for consensus-based probe sets, the representative sequence is only one of several sequences (sequence sub-clusters) used to build the consensus sequence and it is not directly used to derive the probe sequences. The representative sequence is chosen during array design as a sequence that is best associated with the transcribed region being interrogated by the probe set. Refer to the "Sequence Source" field to determine the database used.

Column.Name: Sequence Source
Column.Description: The database from which the sequence used to design this probe set was taken.

Column.Name: Target Description
Column.Description: GenBank description associated with the representative public identifier. Blank for some probe sets.

Column.Name: Gene Title
Column.Description: Title of Gene represented by the probe set.

Column.Name: Gene Symbol
Column.Description: A gene symbol, when one is available (from UniGene).

Column.Name: ENTREZ_GENE_ID
Column.Description: Entrez Gene Database UID

Column.Name: RefSeq Transcript ID
Column.Description: References to multiple sequences in RefSeq. The field contains the ID and Description for each entry, and there can be multiple entries per ProbeSet.

Column.Name: Gene Ontology Biological Process
Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Biological Process derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Column.Name: Gene Ontology Cellular Component
Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Cellular Component derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Column.Name: Gene Ontology Molecular Function
Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Molecular Function derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Platform.Title: [E_coli_2] Affymetrix E. coli Genome 2.0 Array
Platform.Description:
Affymetrix submissions are typically submitted to GEO using the GEOarchive method described at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/geo/info/geo_affy.html
The GeneChipÂ® E. coli Genome 2.0 Array contains probe sets to detect transcripts from the K12 strain of E. coli and three pathogenic strains of E. coli. Using the new E. coli Genome 2.0 Array, researchers can gain a comprehensive view of three pathogenic forms of E. coli while continuing ongoing research projects with the K12 strain.
The GeneChip E. coli Genome 2.0 Array includes approximately 10,000 probe sets for all 20,366 genes present in four strains of E. coli. Due to the high degree of similarity between the E. coli strains, whenever possible, a single probe set is tiled to represent the equivalent ortholog in all four strains. The GeneChip E. coli Genome 2.0 Array tiles probe sets over the entire open reading frame (ORF) of E. coli, includes over 700 intergenic regions, probes for various antibiotic resistance markers, and incorporates additional control and reporter genes from the previous generation E. coli array.

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: Affymetrix Probe Set ID

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Entrez Gene Locus

Column.Name: GB_ACC
Column.Description: GenBank Accession Number

The representative sequence is chosen during array design as a sequence that is best associated with the transcribed region being interrogated by the probe set. Column.Description: Gene Ontology Consortium Biological Process derived from LocusLink. Each annotation consists of three parts: "Accession Number // Description // Evidence". The description corresponds directly to the GO ID. The evidence can be "direct", or "extended".

Sample.Title: BW25113 ompA/pCA24N

Channel.Source: E. coli BW25113 ompA/pCA24N suspension cells
Channel.Characteristics: suspension cells of E. coli K-12 ompA/pCA24N after 7 hours of growth in LB with 0.1 mM IPTG and 30 ug/mL chloramphenicol at 37ÂºC
Channel.Extract-Protocol: The overnight culture was used to 1:100 inoculate 25 ml of fresh LB medium with 0.1 mM IPTG and 30 ug/mL chloramphenicol. After incubation for 7 h at 37Â°C with shaking (250 rpm), cells were collected. After breaking the cells with a bead beater, and the total RNA was isolated with Qiagen RNeasy mini Kit.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. cDNA was synthesized first using Promega M-MLV Reverse transcriptase (cat# M1705). After removing RNA, DNA fragmentation was performed to obtain and 50-200 base cDNA fragments. The fragmented cDNA was labelled with Biotin-ddUTP using Enzo BioArray Terminal Labeling Kit (Affymetrix, P/N 900181)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. Prepared hybridization cocktail for Single Probe Array (49 Format) with total 80 ul volume including 1X hybrization buffer, 50 pM B2 Control Oligo, 0.1 mg/mL Herring Sperm DNA, 0.5 mg/mL BSA, and at least 1 ug fragmented and labelled cDNA. After loading of hybridization cocktail in Affymetrix E. coli Antisense Genome Array, the hybridization was performed at 45ÂºC, with 60 rpm for 16 hours. After hybridization, the probe array was washed and stained using Affymetrix Genechip Fluidics Station 450 and the software GenomeChipOperating Software (GCOS)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. After washing and staining, the probe array was scanned using Affymetrix Genechip scanner GCS3000 7G system and the software GenomeChipOperating Software (GCOS)
Sample.Description: RNA extracted from suspension cells of E. coli BW25113 ompA/pCA24N after 7 h of growth in LB+0.1 mM IPTG at 37ÂºC.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Signal intensity accepted from the probeset

Column.Name: ABS_CALL
Column.Description: Probeset signal: absent or present

Column.Name: DETECTION P-VALUE
Column.Description: Probeset signal: p-value (shows the coherency of the results)

Sample.Title: BW25113 ompA polystyrene biofilm cells

Channel.Source: E. coli K-12 BW25113 ompA polystyrene biofilm cells
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K-12 BW25113 ompA mutant
polystyrene biofilm cells of E. coli K-12 BW25113 ompA after 15 hours of growth in LB at 37ÂºC
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Overnight culture were 1:100 reinoculated into 300 mL LB culture with ~30 g polystyrene particles. Biofilm cells from polystyrene surfaces were collected after 37ËC incubation for 15 h. After breaking the cells with a bead beater, and the total RNA was isolated with Qiagen RNeasy mini Kit.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. cDNA was synthesized first using Promega M-MLV Reverse transcriptase (cat# M1705). After loading of hybridization cocktail in Affymetrix E. coli Antisense Genome Array, the hybridization was performed at 45ÂºC, with 60 rpm for 16 hours. After hybridization, the probe array was washed and stained using Affymetrix Genechip Fluidics Station 450 and the software GenomeChipOperating Software (GCOS)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. After washing and staining, the probe array was scanned using Affymetrix Genechip scanner GCS3000 7G system and the software GenomeChipOperating Software (GCOS)
Sample.Description: RNA extracted from polystyrene biofilm cells of E. coli K-12 BW25113 ompA after 15 hours of growth in LB at 37ÂºC

Sample.Title: BW25113 w/t LB 15 h 37C polystyrene biofilm cell (repeat)

Channel.Source: E. coli K-12 BW25113 wild type polystyrene biofilm cells
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli K-12 BW25113 wild type
polystyrene biofilm cells of E. coli K-12 wild type after 15 hours of growth in LB at 37ÂºC
Channel.Extract-Protocol: The overnight culture (2.5 ml) was used to inoculate 250 ml of fresh LB medium with 30 g of submerged polystyrene particles for forming biofilm. After incubation for 15 h at 37Â°C with shaking (250 rpm), the polystyrene particles was carefully and quickly removed and rinsed with 100 ml of sterile 0.85% NaCl solution at 0Â°C. Biofilm cells were removed by sonicating the polystyrene particles in 200 ml of sterile 0.85% NaCl solution at 0Â°C. After breaking the cells with a bead beater, and the total RNA was isolated with Qiagen RNeasy mini Kit (Cat# 74104).
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. cDNA was synthesized first using Promega M-MLV Reverse transcriptase (cat# M1705). After removing RNA, DNA fragmentation was performed to obtain and 50-200 base cDNA fragments. The fragmented cDNA was labelled with Biotin-ddUTP using Enzo BioArray Terminal Labeling Kit (Affymetrix, P/N 900181)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. Prepared hybridization cocktail for Single Probe Array (49 Format) with total 80 ul volume including 1X hybrization buffer, 50 pM B2 Control Oligo, 0.1 mg/mL Herring Sperm DNA, 0.5 mg/mL BSA, and at least 1 ug fragmented and labelled cDNA. After loading of hybridization cocktail in Affymetrix E. coli Genome 2.0 Array, the hybridization was performed at 45ÂºC, with 60 rpm for 16 hours. After hybridization, the probe array was washed and stained using Affymetrix Genechip Fluidics Station 450 and the software GenomeChipOperating Software (GCOS)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Following affymetrix protocol. After washing and staining, the probe array was scanned using Affymetrix Genechip scanner GCS3000 7G system and the software GenomeChipOperating Software (GCOS)
Sample.Description: RNA extracted from polystyrene biofilm cells of E. coli K-12 wild type after 15 hours of growth in LB at 37ÂºC

Column.Description: Signal intensity accepted from the probeset

Column.Name: ABS_CALL
Column.Description: Probeset signal: absent or present

Column.Name: DETECTION P-VALUE
Column.Description: Probeset signal: p-value (shows the coherency of the results)

Series.Title: E. coli BW25113 ompA mutant vs wild type biofilm and E. coli BW25113 ompA/pCA24N_ompA vs ompA/pCA24N suspension cells
Series.Summary: This Series involves two studies: 1) The gene expression of E. coli K-12 BW25113 ompA mutant strain vs. wild type strain glasswool biofilm cells and E. coli K-12 BW25113 ompA mutant vs. wild type polystyrene biofilm cells. 2) The gene expression of E. coli BW25113 ompA/pCA24N_ompA vs. ompA/pCA24N suspension cells.
Series.Overall-Design:
Strains: E. coli K-12 BW25113 wild type, ompA mutant Medium: LB Cell type: Biofilm cells grown on glasswool and polystyrene surfaces Time: 15 h
Temperature: 37C Strains: BW25113 ompA/pCA24N_ompA and ompA/pCA24N Medium: LB Time: 7 h Temperature: 37C Cell type: suspension cells, induced by 0.1 mM IPTG
